us.title: Cronos (CRO) soars 31% since Trump teamed up with Crypto.com
us.content: The week that started on Monday, March 24, has been bloody in the equity markets and, by Friday, March 28, ensured that cryptocurrencies have also joined the plunge with a $100 billion 24-hour valuation drop.

us.title: Consumers' Mood Sours in March With Gloomier Economic Outlook
us.content: Consumer sentiment has declined significantly in March, with the University of Michigan's survey showing a drop in the headline index to 57, the lowest level since 2022.

us.title: Markets Tumble as Fed's Favorite Inflation Gauge Spikes; Bitcoin Slides, Stocks Dump
us.content: The U.S. Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure elevated sharply in February, with the core personal consumption expenditures price index climbing 0.4%—the largest monthly spike since January 2024—while consumer spending growth fell short of expectations, the Commerce Department reported Friday.

us.title: Bitcoin Dips Below $85K as Hot PCE Data Sparks Inflation Fears
us.content: The “core” personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index makes it easier to capture underlying inflation trends by excluding food and energy, which tend to experience higher price volatility than other consumption categories. us.title: Dow tumbles over 500 points on inflation worries, Trump tariffs
us.content: Wall Street's main indexes slumped on Friday, as fresh data highlighted an uptick in underlying price pressures that surpassed expectations, igniting concerns that the Trump administration's tariff strategies might further fan the flames of inflation.

us.title: The inflation data was a 'little noisy' today, says Wilmington Trust's Tony Roth
us.content: Tony Roth, Wilmington Trust Investment Advisors CIO, joins ‘Money Movers' to discuss today's inflation data, recent market volatility, and more.

us.title: Galaxy Digital faces $200M settlement over LUNA involvement
us.content: The New York Attorney General (AG) office has commenced an investigation on Galaxy Digital with a settlement of $200 million over its involvement in the LUNA cryptocurrency. The crypto crashed alongside Terra Blockchain powered by Terraform Labs and led to the erasure of over $40 billion in investor funds.

us.title: Consumer spending ticks up — but so does inflation — amid Trump tariffs jitters
us.content: The Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) price index increased 0.3% in February after advancing by an unrevised 0.3% in January, the U.S. Commerce Department said on Friday.

us.title: South Carolina Drops Staking Lawsuit, Proposes Bitcoin Reserve Bill
us.content: South Carolina dropped its staking lawsuit against Coinbase on March 27. The lawsuit accused Coinbase of offering unregistered securities.

us.title: Walt Disney set for recovery in experiences business, analysts foresee growth in 2025
us.content: Walt Disney Co (NYSE:DIS, ETR:WDP) has earned a repeat ‘Buy' rating from analysts at Bank of America, who remain optimistic about the entertainment giant's growth prospects in 2025. The analysts awarded the stock a $140 price target.

us.title: How carmakers are bracing for Trump's 25% auto tariffs
us.content: CNBC's Phil LeBeau reports on how the auto industry plans to minimize the impact of 25% tariffs.

us.title: Trump's Tariffs Are Looming Over Stocks. Watch Out on April 2.
us.content: It was only Monday that the market was rising on hopes that tariffs wouldn't turn out too badly. However, after Wednesday's announcement of 25% levies on foreign autos and auto parts, it's easy to understand why the mood has turned grimmer.

us.title: Chart Of The Day: Why I'm Worried About Semis And Semis
us.content: Semiconductors and transportation stocks both serve as good economic and market indicators. The VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF peaked all the way back in the summer of 2024.

us.title: Tariffs may be a good political strategy, but it's a bad economic one, says Evercore's Roger Altman
us.content: Roger Altman, Evercore founder, joins 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss the markets, impact of tariffs and consumer sentiment.

us.title: Consumer confidence numbers weakest since November 2022
us.content: CNBC's Rick Santelli joins 'Squawk on the Street' to report on the consumer sentiment data numbers.

france.title: Chances of Fed Rate Hike Are Rising, Bullard Says
france.content: James Bullard, former St. Louis fed president and Dean of the Mitchell E. Daniels Jr. School of Business at Purdue University, says the chances of a Federal Reserve rate hike are rising.

france.title: General Electric (NYSE:GE) Maintains Strong Position in Aerospace with Bernstein's "Outperform" Rating
france.content:
• Bernstein raises the price target for General Electric (NYSE:GE) Aerospace from $232 to $250, highlighting the division's recent achievements and technological prowess.
  • GE Aerospace secures a significant contract with Korean Air for GEnx and GE9X engines, reinforcing its market position and showcasing its engineering excellence.
  • Despite a slight decrease in stock price, GE's market presence remains dynamic, with a current trading price of $205.88 and a market capitalization of around $220.97 billion.

General Electric (NYSE:GE) is a multinational conglomerate known for its diverse operations, including aviation, healthcare, and power. GE Aerospace, a key division, focuses on manufacturing jet engines and providing related services. The company competes with other aerospace giants like Rolls-Royce and Pratt & Whitney. Recently, Bernstein maintained an "Outperform" rating for GE, with the stock priced at $205.88.

Bernstein's decision to raise the price target for GE Aerospace from $232 to $250 is supported by the division's recent achievements. GE Aerospace secured a major contract with Korean Air to supply GEnx and GE9X engines for their Boeing 787-10 and 777-9 aircraft. This deal strengthens GE's position in the aerospace market and highlights its technological prowess.

The GEnx engine family, with over 62 million flight hours, is a testament to GE's engineering excellence. With more than 3,600 engines in service or on backlog, the GEnx engine powers two-thirds of all Boeing 787 aircraft. The GE9X engine, chosen by Korean Air, offers a 10% improvement in fuel efficiency over its predecessor, enhancing the airline's operational efficiency.

Korean Air's decision to select GE Aerospace engines underscores the strong partnership between the two companies. The order includes a service agreement for maintenance, repair, and overhaul of the GE9X engines, marking a first in South Korea. This collaboration aligns with Korean Air's vision of fleet expansion and excellence, as highlighted by Walter Cho, Chairman and CEO of Korean Air.

Despite the positive developments, GE's stock price has seen a slight decrease of $1.49, or approximately -0.72%, currently trading at $205.88. The stock has fluctuated between $202.80 and $207.69 today, with a market capitalization of around $220.97 billion. Over the past year, GE's stock has ranged from a low of $133.99 to a high of $214.21, reflecting its dynamic market presence.

france.title: EU Plans Concessions to Make for Trump on Tariffs
france.content: The EU is identifying concessions to make to the Trump administration to secure the partial removal of US tariffs. Tyler Kendall reports on "Bloomberg Open Interest.

france.title: Positioning to weather volatility fueled by Trump's tariffs
france.content: In light of ongoing uncertainty and tariff impacts, companies are facing a challenging environment when forecasting business outcomes. NYSE senior market strategist Michael Reinking joins Morning Brief hosts Brad Smith and Madison Mills to discuss the difficulty in positioning businesses amid shifting consumer sentiment.

france.title: Wall Street Braces for Higher Metals Prices as Tariff War Intensifies
france.content: Both base and precious metals are among the top-performing assets as the end to the first quarter nears, and the momentum is expected to continue as long as the trade war lasts.
